document_data.name: Gandios Laffabar
document_data.mainbody: '''Gandios Laffabar''' was the owner and proprietor of the [[Giant's Folly]] festhall that operated [[Reddansyr]] during the midâ€“14{{th}} century [[DR]].
document_data.Personality: He was a man that could readily tell a grand story to impressionable adventurers, often leading others on wild-goose-chases that may or may not have led to them in peril.
document_data.Relationships: The successful business owner was inadvertently at odds with Patriarch [[Thyrius Jorman]], head of the local temple of [[Oghma]].
document_data.History:
Gandios famously lost a wager with a [[fire giant]] involving the transportation of a boat inland to Reddansyr from [[Westgate]]. Not one to be defeated, Gandios made another bet that won him the boat, and with it a great story and name for his future establishment. 

Business was so successful as of the {{YearlinkName|1367}}, he thought about bringing over a second boat from Westgate to Reddansyr.
